goal.ch:
Mission statement: To help upper-intermediate English learners acquire key business communication skills through the study of modern workplace TV series.

This course is designed to offer a dynamic and immersive English learning experience with the goal of enhancing upper-intermediate students’ business English communication skills for professional settings through the use of workplace TV shows as a medium, alongside other materials from business book titles. It focuses on three aspects of the English language: speaking eloquence, listening competency, and vocabulary variety. 

The objective can be broken down as follows:
1. To improve students‘ English proficiency in key business skills within everyday workplace scenarios. Business TV shows can facilitate their understanding of real-life English usage in professional settings.
2. To boost students’ critical thinking and problem-solving capability for work. Watching business TV show characters handle challenges at work can help students develop relevant strategies for their own professional lives.
3. To spark interest and provide ample resources for students to learn workplace English. TV shows captivate students better than usual materials, promote higher engagement, and offer more learning opportunities due to their extended content.
4. To Instill students with confidence for workplace English proficiency tests like TOEIC and Linguaskill Business, aiming at CEFR Level B2 or higher. Official certification at this level can notably elevate their job prospects.

textbook.ch:
Various materials from workplace/business TV shows such as ‘The Office’ series (US version), ‘Suits’ series, ‘The IT Crowd’ series, ‘Emily in Paris’ series, ‘Shark Tank’ series, ‘Succession’ series, ‘Parks and Recreation’ series, ‘The Good Fight’ series, ‘Mad Men’ series, and ‘Billions’ series.

Other materials encompass workplace-relevant titles such as ‘English for Key Business Skills: Networking, Presentations, Meetings, and Negotiations’, ‘Business Vision‘, ‘In Company 3.0‘ series, ‘Work Advantage‘ series, ‘Market Leader‘ series, ‘Business Result‘ series, and ‘English Works for the Office‘ series.
